title: How to Make Earl Grey Punch

steps.headline: Boil water for tea.
steps.description: Place 1 ¼ cups (295.73 ml) of water in a kettle or pot on the stove. Heat the water until boiling, then pour the hot water into a large heatproof bowl.

steps.headline: Steep the tea for 5 minutes.
steps.description: After you pour the boiling water in the bowl, add the Earl Grey teabags or tea leaves and let the tea steep for 5 minutes in the hot water. Don’t steep the tea for longer than five minutes. When black tea is steeped for too long, the tea acquires a bitter taste.

steps.headline: Remove the teabags and let the tea cool.
steps.description: After the tea has steeped, remove the teabags or strain the tea leaves out by pouring the tea through a fine mesh strainer into another heatproof measuring cup or bowl. Let the tea cool for around twenty minutes.

steps.headline: Combine they honey, thyme, rosemary and water in a pot.
steps.description: While you are letting the tea cool, add the ½ cup (118.3 ml) honey, 2 sprigs each of thyme and rosemary, and ½ cup (118.3 ml) of water to a saucepan over medium heat.

steps.headline: Bring the mixture to a simmer and discard the herbs.
steps.description: Heat the honey, herbs and water until they reach a gentle simmer. Then turn off the heat and pick out and discard the herbs from the mixture.

steps.headline: Combine all the ingredients in a large pitcher and cool.
steps.description: Pour the tea, honey syrup, lemon juice, cognac, bourbon and bitters into a pitcher or a punch bowl. Then pour in 2 cups (473.18 ml) of ice into the mixture and stir.

steps.headline: Serve the punch while cold.
steps.description: Serve the punch directly after preparing it so that it’s cold, or place the pitcher of punch in the refrigerator to keep it cool and serve it later. If you aren’t serving it immediately, wait to add the ice until right before you serve it.

steps.headline: Combine the rum and tea leaves.
steps.description: Earl Grey rum punch is a fruity and tropical spin on an Early Grey punch. To begin making this punch, pour the ½ cup (118.3 ml) of white rum into a bowl or measuring cup, then add the 1 ½ teaspoons (7.39 ml) loose Earl Grey tea into the rum.

steps.headline: Infuse the rum for 1 hour.
steps.description: Stir the tea leaves into the rum, then let them soak in the rum for an hour. Soaking the tea leaves in the rum infuses the rum with the flavor of Earl Grey.

steps.headline: Strain the rum into a measuring cup.
steps.description: Place a fine mesh strainer over a 2 cup (473.18 ml) measuring cup, then pour the rum through the strainer so that all the tea leaves are caught in the strainer.

steps.headline: Add the rest of the ingredients.
steps.description: Pour the ¼ cup (59.15 ml) pineapple juice, 2 tablespoons (9.86 ml) apricot liqueur, 1 tablespoon (14.79 ml) lime juice , 1 tablespoon (14.79 ml) lemon juice, 2 teaspoons (9.86 ml) Simple Syrup and 2 dashes of angostura bitters into the measuring cup along with the infused rum.

steps.headline: Pour the Earl Grey punch over ice and serve.
steps.description:
Pour ice into a pitcher or into 2 cocktail glasses, then pour the punch over the ice. Serve the punch while chilled or store the punch in the refrigerator to keep it cool
If not serving immediately, wait until directly before serving before adding the ice.

methods.name: Making Earl Grey Lemon Vodka Punch

steps.headline: Brew Earl Grey tea.
steps.description: Earl Grey lemon vodka punch is a simple punch that combines the delicious flavors of black tea and lemon. To begin making this punch, place 3 cups (709.77 ml) of water into a pot on the stove. Heat the pot on medium heat until boiling, then turn the heat down to a simmer and add the Earl Grey teabags or tea leaves.

steps.headline: Brew the tea for five minutes.
steps.description: Let the tea steep in the hot water for five minutes, then remove the teabags or if using tea leaves, pour the tea through a fine mesh strainer into a heatproof bowl. Then let the tea cool until it is warm but not hot, about twenty minutes.

steps.headline: Place the raw sugar and the warm tea in a punch bowl.
steps.description: Add the 9 ½ tablespoons (140.47 ml) of raw sugar into a large bowl or punch vessel, then pour in the warm Earl Grey tea. Stir the sugar in with the tea until it dissolves.

steps.headline: Slice and add the lemons to the punch bowl.
steps.description: Wash the three lemons, then thinly slice them into rounds. Add the lemon rounds into the punch bowl to give the punch added flavor.

steps.headline: Add the vodka and let the punch chill for 2 hours.
steps.description: After you add the lemons, pour in the vodka and mix. Then place the punch bowl in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours to let the punch chill and the flavors to mix.

steps.headline: Add ice and serve.
steps.description: When you are ready to serve the punch, add your desired amount of ice to the punch bowl, then serve the drink while cold!

text:
Making Earl Grey Bourbon Punch Boil water for tea. Place 1 ¼ cups (295.73 ml) of water in a kettle or pot on the stove. Heat the water until boiling, then pour the hot water into a large heatproof bowl. Steep the tea for 5 minutes. After you pour the boiling water in the bowl, add the Earl Grey teabags or tea leaves and let the tea steep for 5 minutes in the hot water. Don’t steep the tea for longer than five minutes. When black tea is steeped for too long, the tea acquires a bitter taste. Remove the teabags and let the tea cool. After the tea has steeped, remove the teabags or strain the tea leaves out by pouring the tea through a fine mesh strainer into another heatproof measuring cup or bowl. Let the tea cool for around twenty minutes. Combine they honey, thyme, rosemary and water in a pot. While you are letting the tea cool, add the ½ cup (118.3 ml) honey, 2 sprigs each of thyme and rosemary, and ½ cup (118.3 ml) of water to a saucepan over medium heat. Bring the mixture to a simmer and discard the herbs. Heat the honey, herbs and water until they reach a gentle simmer. Then turn off the heat and pick out and discard the herbs from the mixture. Combine all the ingredients in a large pitcher and cool. Pour the tea, honey syrup, lemon juice, cognac, bourbon and bitters into a pitcher or a punch bowl. Then pour in 2 cups (473.18 ml) of ice into the mixture and stir. Serve the punch while cold. Serve the punch directly after preparing it so that it’s cold, or place the pitcher of punch in the refrigerator to keep it cool and serve it later. If you aren’t serving it immediately, wait to add the ice until right before you serve it. Preparing Earl Grey Rum Punch Combine the rum and tea leaves. Earl Grey rum punch is a fruity and tropical spin on an Early Grey punch. To begin making this punch, pour the ½ cup (118.3 ml) of white rum into a bowl or measuring cup, then add the 1 ½ teaspoons (7.39 ml) loose Earl Grey tea into the rum. Infuse the rum for 1 hour. Stir the tea leaves into the rum, then let them soak in the rum for an hour. Soaking the tea leaves in the rum infuses the rum with the flavor of Earl Grey. Strain the rum into a measuring cup. Place a fine mesh strainer over a 2 cup (473.18 ml) measuring cup, then pour the rum through the strainer so that all the tea leaves are caught in the strainer. Add the rest of the ingredients. Pour the ¼ cup (59.15 ml) pineapple juice, 2 tablespoons (9.86 ml) apricot liqueur, 1 tablespoon (14.79 ml) lime juice , 1 tablespoon (14.79 ml) lemon juice, 2 teaspoons (9.86 ml) Simple Syrup and 2 dashes of angostura bitters into the measuring cup along with the infused rum. Pour the Earl Grey punch over ice and serve. Pour ice into a pitcher or into 2 cocktail glasses, then pour the punch over the ice. Serve the punch while chilled or store the punch in the refrigerator to keep it cool
If not serving immediately, wait until directly before serving before adding the ice. Making Earl Grey Lemon Vodka Punch Brew Earl Grey tea. Earl Grey lemon vodka punch is a simple punch that combines the delicious flavors of black tea and lemon. To begin making this punch, place 3 cups (709.77 ml) of water into a pot on the stove. Heat the pot on medium heat until boiling, then turn the heat down to a simmer and add the Earl Grey teabags or tea leaves. Brew the tea for five minutes. Let the tea steep in the hot water for five minutes, then remove the teabags or if using tea leaves, pour the tea through a fine mesh strainer into a heatproof bowl. Then let the tea cool until it is warm but not hot, about twenty minutes. Place the raw sugar and the warm tea in a punch bowl. Add the 9 ½ tablespoons (140.47 ml) of raw sugar into a large bowl or punch vessel, then pour in the warm Earl Grey tea. Stir the sugar in with the tea until it dissolves. Slice and add the lemons to the punch bowl. Wash the three lemons, then thinly slice them into rounds. Add the lemon rounds into the punch bowl to give the punch added flavor. Add the vodka and let the punch chill for 2 hours. After you add the lemons, pour in the vodka and mix. Then place the punch bowl in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours to let the punch chill and the flavors to mix. Add ice and serve. When you are ready to serve the punch, add your desired amount of ice to the punch bowl, then serve the drink while cold! Finished.
sentences: Making Earl Grey Bourbon Punch Boil water for tea.
Place 1 ¼ cups (295.73 ml) of water in a kettle or pot on the stove.
Heat the water until boiling, then pour the hot water into a large heatproof bowl.
Steep the tea for 5 minutes.
After you pour the boiling water in the bowl, add the Earl Grey teabags or tea leaves and let the tea steep for 5 minutes in the hot water.
Don’t steep the tea for longer than five minutes.
When black tea is steeped for too long, the tea acquires a bitter taste.
Remove the teabags and let the tea cool.
After the tea has steeped, remove the teabags or strain the tea leaves out by pouring the tea through a fine mesh strainer into another heatproof measuring cup or bowl.
Let the tea cool for around twenty minutes.
Combine they honey, thyme, rosemary and water in a pot.
While you are letting the tea cool, add the ½ cup (118.3 ml) honey, 2 sprigs each of thyme and rosemary, and ½ cup (118.3 ml) of water to a saucepan over medium heat.
Bring the mixture to a simmer and discard the herbs.
Heat the honey, herbs and water until they reach a gentle simmer.
Then turn off the heat and pick out and discard the herbs from the mixture.
Combine all the ingredients in a large pitcher and cool.
Pour the tea, honey syrup, lemon juice, cognac, bourbon and bitters into a pitcher or a punch bowl.
Then pour in 2 cups (473.18 ml) of ice into the mixture and stir.
Serve the punch while cold.
Serve the punch directly after preparing it so that it’s cold, or place the pitcher of punch in the refrigerator to keep it cool and serve it later.
If you aren’t serving it immediately, wait to add the ice until right before you serve it.
Preparing Earl Grey Rum Punch Combine the rum and tea leaves.
Earl Grey rum punch is a fruity and tropical spin on an Early Grey punch.
To begin making this punch, pour the ½ cup (118.3 ml) of white rum into a bowl or measuring cup, then add the 1 ½ teaspoons (7.39 ml) loose Earl Grey tea into the rum.
Infuse the rum for 1 hour.
Stir the tea leaves into the rum, then let them soak in the rum for an hour.
Soaking the tea leaves in the rum infuses the rum with the flavor of Earl Grey.
Strain the rum into a measuring cup.
Place a fine mesh strainer over a 2 cup (473.18 ml) measuring cup, then pour the rum through the strainer so that all the tea leaves are caught in the strainer.
Add the rest of the ingredients.

Pour the ¼ cup (59.15 ml) pineapple juice, 2 tablespoons (9.86 ml) apricot liqueur, 1 tablespoon (14.79 ml) lime juice , 1 tablespoon (14.79 ml) lemon juice, 2 teaspoons (9.86 ml) Simple Syrup and 2 dashes of angostura bitters into the measuring cup along with the infused rum.
Pour the Earl Grey punch over ice and serve.
Pour ice into a pitcher or into 2 cocktail glasses, then pour the punch over the ice.

Serve the punch while chilled or store the punch in the refrigerator to keep it cool
If not serving immediately, wait until directly before serving before adding the ice.
Making Earl Grey Lemon Vodka Punch Brew Earl Grey tea.
Earl Grey lemon vodka punch is a simple punch that combines the delicious flavors of black tea and lemon.
To begin making this punch, place 3 cups (709.77 ml) of water into a pot on the stove.
Heat the pot on medium heat until boiling, then turn the heat down to a simmer and add the Earl Grey teabags or tea leaves.
Brew the tea for five minutes.
Let the tea steep in the hot water for five minutes, then remove the teabags or if using tea leaves, pour the tea through a fine mesh strainer into a heatproof bowl.
Then let the tea cool until it is warm but not hot, about twenty minutes.
Place the raw sugar and the warm tea in a punch bowl.
Add the 9 ½ tablespoons (140.47 ml) of raw sugar into a large bowl or punch vessel, then pour in the warm Earl Grey tea.
Stir the sugar in with the tea until it dissolves.
Slice and add the lemons to the punch bowl.
Wash the three lemons, then thinly slice them into rounds.
Add the lemon rounds into the punch bowl to give the punch added flavor.
Add the vodka and let the punch chill for 2 hours.
After you add the lemons, pour in the vodka and mix.
Then place the punch bowl in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours to let the punch chill and the flavors to mix.
Add ice and serve.
When you are ready to serve the punch, add your desired amount of ice to the punch bowl, then serve the drink while cold!
Finished.
